mil7.7.8:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil7.7.8:0.2_0: The account of the fault-finding mind
mil7.7.8:1.1_0: “Everyone who is going on the elephant should not engage in what four things have been received?”
mil7.7.8:1.3_0: In the same way, great king, when you fight with a cow youth, you should train like this: ‘Great king.
mil7.7.8:1.4_0: This is the first peril from the great king.
mil7.7.8:2.1_0: Furthermore, take a mind of Māgaṇḍiya whose mind is following their bonds.
mil7.7.8:2.2_0: In the same way, great king, relying on the simile of the saw your mind, you should implemented mind from a village.
mil7.7.8:3.1_0: Furthermore, a great king knows his duty when it is passed away.
mil7.7.8:3.2_0: In the same way, suppose someone were to venerate the cows that they know the time for retreat.
mil7.7.8:4.1_0: Furthermore, Migalaṇḍika sees this deer as a deer hunter, ‘I’m getting this conqueror.’
mil7.7.8:4.2_0: In the same way, great king, Uttamā should pay close attention to the support of the cow, making it unbeneficial. I will go beyond distinction to comprehending the mind,
mil7.7.8:4.3_0: This is the fourth part of a mendicant.
mil7.7.8:4.4_0: I have heard the King, great king, that we’ve praised the senior monks.
mil7.7.8:5.2_0: a resolute monk who loves comfort.
mil7.7.8:5.3_0: The wise should be put aside even more,
